text: Good Morning, Vietnam is a 1987 American war-comedy-drama movie. It was written by Mitch Markowitz and directed by Barry Levinson. It is set in Saigon in 1965, during the Vietnam War. It stars Robin Williams as a radio DJ on Armed Forces Radio Service. Co-stars include Forest Whitaker and Robert Wuhl. The story is loosely based on the experiences of AFRS radio DJ Adrian Cronauer.Urgent Communications, March 1, 2005: "The Real Life of Adrian Cronauer" Retrieved 2012-04-17 Most of Williams' radio broadcasts were improvised. Williams was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role. ==Cast== * Robin Williams as Airman Second Class Adrian Cronauer * Forest Whitaker as Private First Class Edward Montesquieu "Eddie" Garlick * Tung Thanh Tran as Phan Duc To (Phan Dục Tô), aka Tuan * Chintara Sukapatana as Trinh (Trịnh) * Bruno Kirby as Second Lieutenant Steven Hauk * Robert Wuhl as Staff Sergeant Marty Lee Dreiwitz * J.
